meanings.definition: to make a shrill, piercing sound
meanings.sent1: The kettle skreighs loudly when it boils.
meanings.sent2: The owl skreighs in the night, startling the campers.
meanings.sent3: The teapot skreighs like a tiny banshee.
meanings.sent4: The wind skreighs through the trees, a haunting melody.
meanings.sent5: Her scream skreighs through the silent room, chilling everyone.

meanings.sent1: The skreighs of the car brakes echoed through the street.
meanings.sent2: The skreighs of the violin filled the concert hall.
meanings.sent3: The skreighs of the seagulls overhead sounded like a choir of tiny trumpets.
meanings.sent4: The skreighs of the rusty gate made the old house seem haunted.
meanings.sent5: The skreighs of the microphone feedback made the audience cover their ears.
